title: [Large-Scale] Project to Enhance Learner Agency in Smart Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital tool proficiency and general understanding of elementary social studies curriculum
context.additional_context: Current elementary teachers explore methods for designing and operating smart learning environments to enhance learner autonomy, developing practical classroom implementation plans through project execution

learning_goals: Design a learner-customized feedback system utilizing an adaptive learning platform

Within one week, learners develop one project-based learning scenario for social studies history/geography using virtual/augmented reality tools (CoSpaces, Unity, etc.), and submit a result that meets four or more of the five evaluation criteria provided in peer reviews and expert evaluations.

At the end of the one-week course, learners analyze three provided learning data samples to create a five-level rubric (four criteria, each rated on a 1â€“5 scale) for assessing learner autonomy, and receive validity recognition of an average of 4 points or higher from two peer evaluators.

Within one week, learners design strategies for managing large learner groups of 100+ using digital collaboration tools like Google Workspace and Microsoft Teams (including task allocation, progress monitoring, feedback systems), and demonstrate feasibility through peer evaluation and instructor verification.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
